article.headline: William &amp, Mary 74, Delaware 73
article.story: NEWARK, Del. -- David Schneider hit a 3-pointer with 3 seconds left, propelling William & Mary to a 74-73 overtime win against Delaware on Wednesday night. Schneider's game-winning 3 was his second within 10 seconds late in overtime for the Tribe, who hit three 3-pointers in the span of 20 seconds to win the game. JohnMark Ludwick nailed the first 3-pointer of the burst for the Tribe to pull within 72-68, sparking a 9-1 run in the final seconds of OT. Schneider was the only player in double figures for the Tribe (11-3, 3-1 Colonial Athletic Association), finishing with 26 points on 9-for-15 shooting. The senior was 6-for-10 from beyond the arc in the win, but missed a 3-point attempt at the end of regulation, sending the game into overtime tied at 59. Jawan Carter scored 27 points to lead the Blue Hens (5-10, 1-3), including a 3-pointer with 22 seconds left to send the game into OT.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
